thread.title: 76-year-old Boston woman fined for failing to clear snow off sidewalk | Fox News
thread.title_full: 76-year-old Boston woman fined for failing to clear snow off sidewalk | Fox News

title: 76-year-old Boston woman fined for failing to clear snow off sidewalk | Fox News
text:
76-year-old Boston woman fined for failing to clear snow off sidewalk Published February 20, 2017 Facebook 0 Twitter 0 livefyre Email Print 
Tina Fuller, 60, of Waltham, Mass., behind center, walks past a snowman and a person walking a dog, Sunday, Feb. 12, 2017, in Waltham, Mass. (AP) 
A 76-year-old Boston woman received an outpouring of support after she was fined $200 for failing to shovel her sidewalk. 
Lorraine Walsh was one of 500 residents in the city who received citations in the last week, the Boston Herald reported Saturday. Walsh failed to clear a path two weeks ago from her steps to the street and couldn’t get to the rest of it before the snow froze up. 
Walsh was hit with the $200 penalty for businesses instead of the $50 penalty for residents because her brother operates an insurance office out of their home. 
Christian Galvin, a fellow Boston resident, offered to pay for Walsh’s fine if she does not win her appeal. 
“I flat out can’t imagine a 76-year-old trying to break up that ice, and then to read that she received a $200 ticket didn’t sit well with me,” Galvin told the Boston Herald on Sunday. 
Walsh said she’s on a fixed income and would “appreciate it” if the city dismissed the appeal. She added that the entire process could take up to two weeks. 
Mayor Martin J. Walsh, who is not related to Lorraine, told the newspaper that the snow shoveling fines were in place for the public’s safety. But he admitted that he felt bad for the woman. 
“I’m sure they’ll take into account all the circumstances around that,” the mayor said. “I feel bad. She can appeal the ticket. She’s an elderly person, so I want to make sure that we’re not putting a burden on an elderly person that can’t do it.” 
The city handed out 243 tickets for failing to clear the sidewalks on Tuesday, 135 on Monday and 133 on Friday. The fines totaled to $34,650.
